```{r}
# Set up some example data
df <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100))

# Define the function that you want to apply over each row of the dataframe
my_function <- function(x, y) {
  # This is just an example - replace with your own time-consuming code
  Sys.sleep(1)  # Sleep for 1 second to simulate time-consuming code
  return(x + y)
}

# Set up a loop to apply the function over each row of the dataframe
for (i in seq_len(nrow(df))) {
  # Use tryCatch() to catch any errors that might occur
  result <- tryCatch({
    my_function(df$x[i], df$y[i])
  }, error = function(e) {
    # If an error occurs, print a message and return NULL
    cat("Error: ", conditionMessage(e), "\n")
    return(NULL)
  })
  
  # Save the result after each row using saveRDS()
  saveRDS(result, file = paste0("result_", i, ".rds"))
}

# Set up a loop to resume where the previous loop left off
for (i in seq_len(nrow(df))) {
  # Use tryCatch() to catch any errors that might occur
  result <- tryCatch({
    readRDS(file = paste0("result_", i, ".rds"))
  }, error = function(e) {
    # If an error occurs, print a message and return NULL
    cat("Error: ", conditionMessage(e), "\n")
    return(NULL)
  })
  
  # If the result is not NULL, print it to the console
  if (!is.null(result)) {
    cat("Result for row ", i, ": ", result, "\n")
  }
}
```
